body:
This has been discussed [here](https://groups.google.com/forum/?fromgroups#!searchin/assertj/field/assertj/TSapxQmhaSU/om2NkLWNh0IJ) and I was waiting for more people to ask for this feature.

I agree that if fields override equals then is should be used and otherwise fall back to field by field comparison. Another point is to manage cycles.

I won't modify the existing assertion but create another one named:  `isEqualToComparingFieldByFieldRecursively()`

I'd like to voice my support for adding a recursive version of the field-by-field comparator. It took me by surprise that the exising `isEqualToComparingFieldByField()` does not work recursively already. Thanks!

issue.title: usingFieldByFieldElementComparator doesn't work for list fields

repository.name: assertj
repository.description: Fluent testing assertions for Java and the JVM

body: Hello, I vote for this feature. Thanks!

I guess it should be possible to adapt a Apache 2 licensed implementation of deepEquals for AssertJ, e.g.: https://github.com/jdereg/java-util/blob/master/src/main/java/com/cedarsoftware/util/DeepEquals.java 

@joel-costigliola I could give it a try, if you are o.k. with this approach?
Agrred, let's not reinvent a recursive comparison.

issue.title: "isEqualToComparingFieldByField" doesn't perform deep comparison

repository.name: assertj
repository.description: Fluent testing assertions for Java and the JVM

issue.body: In case if object under assert has some complex types as fields (POJOs) and POJO field is equal, but is different instance "AssertionError" is generated. I Think we need to implement "isEqualToComparingDeepFieldByField" assertion method and compare fields recursively.

body: I'm also waiting for this feature it will make tests even more neat. @PascalSchumacher  Let's finish you implementation and get PR merged to master branch.

Exactly 2 years since this was requested today.

Any chance of getting it merged to master?
It is planned for 2.4/3.4, I haven't had the time to review the PR yet but it is definitely on my todo list.
